meanings.definition: To change the order or arrangement of a set of things
meanings.sent1: She permutated the books on the shelf to make space for the new ones.
meanings.sent2: The students permutated their seating arrangement for group work.
meanings.sent3: The chef permutated the ingredients in the recipe, creating a surprising new dish.
meanings.sent4: The garden was like a permutated puzzle, each plant fitting perfectly in its place.
meanings.sent5: The magician permutated the cards in a mesmerizing display of skill.

meanings.definition: To rearrange in all possible ways
meanings.sent1: He permutated the colors on the Rubik's cube until he solved it.
meanings.sent2: The computer program permutated the data to find the optimal solution.
meanings.sent3: The children permutated the building blocks into imaginative structures.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts permutated like a kaleidoscope, forming new ideas with each turn.
meanings.sent5: The artist permutated the shapes in the painting, creating a dynamic composition.
